Key Match Events: South Africa beat the Netherlands by four wickets in New York.
David Miller made an unbeaten 59 as Proteas won with seven balls to spare.
South Africa had slipped to 12-4 in the fifth over, including Quinton de Kock being run out off the first ball of the innings.
Ottniel Baartman took 4-11 as Proteas restricted the Dutch to 103-9.
A six to win the match from David Miller and South Africa have beaten the Netherlands by four wickets.
With two overs to go, South Africa needed 18 runs to win and David Miller found all of them with seven balls of the innings to spare.
Miller punished De Leede, smashing that shot through the leg side and all of the way.
David Miller passed 50 with a lofted cover drive for four.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Aiden Markram: 'We've got to give a lot of credit to how the Netherlands played, we knew they'd be up for a scrap. They applied a lot of pressure to us.'

Markram: 'It is a game of cricket ultimately and they've proven many times they can beat the best teams in the world. There isn't a mental block or anything and once a team gets a bit of momentum, particularly the Netherlands, they make things quite tricky. It shows we're moving forward as a squad and dealing with these things better.'

Markram: 'It is big for us. The wins aren't always going to be pretty and convincing but if you look at 12-4 not many people are giving us a chance from there and it is massive for the team, environment and confidence to win.'
Markram: 'We've been good with the ball and in the field, lots of energy. The top order need to take responsibility when given the opportunity to.'

Netherlands captain Scott Edwards: 'Obviously extremely close. With 110 on the board, only an over can change a game. Credit to South Africa, they bowled extremely well. We had a nice partnership but then they batted extremely well at the end.'
Edwards on the pitch: 'It's hard to tell. There was more in it in the start but it was just different.'
Edwards on the Netherlands' form: 'I think we pride ourselves on playing good tournament cricket. It is probably a little bit about that, but not to be today.'
Edwards on how long he had faith for: 'Right until that last six, I back our guys. I felt like we were one wicket away. If we got David [Miller], we would've had a shot.'
Player of the match, South Africa's David Miller: 'My heart is a whole lot better now! It was a good finish in the end I suppose.'

Miller: 'The pitch played a bit better than the first game. Credit to the Netherlands guys, they bowled really well and hit an area really well. Me and Stubbo [Tristan Stubbs] just needed to create something and keep the scoreboard ticking along.'
Miller: 'It was a low total so we wanted to show some intent and not go into our shell but they made it difficult but we just ground it out as well as we could.'
Miller: 'We have got over the line with our tailenders in the past so I had faith in the boys. I felt the first ball of the penultimate over made me feel like we could finish the game.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa have put the Dutch hoodoo to bed but my goodness they were given a fright.
It wasn't a very David Miller-like innings but that shows the calmness in his head.
Miller knew exactly what he was doing not taking the single off the last ball of the 18th over.
